message.content:
cs.IT, cs.CC, cs.SI, cs.DS, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with decoding techniques for polar codes, which are a type of error-correcting code used in information theory. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses modifications to the LP decoding technique, which is a linear programming approach to decoding codes, and hence cs.CC (Computational Complexity) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also presents an algorithm to obtain a smaller factor graph from the original sparse factor graph of a polar code, which falls under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as it deals with network representation. Finally, the paper discusses the performance of the proposed decoder, which falls under cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it deals with improving the performance of a decoding algorithm.
